name: Amanda Stavri
background: Amanda Stavri serves as Commissioning Editor, Factual Entertainment at ITV. Focus areas: Factual entertainment. They are looking for returnable formats with strong hooks; presenter-led factual with established talent. ITV seeks accessible factual content with broad mainstream appeal that connects with viewers across the UK through relatable characters, compelling storytelling and familiar institutions.
thematic_priorities: High-impact, accessible documentaries with broad mainstream appeal
Crime documentaries with unique access or perspective
Character-driven factual series with relatable individuals
Access-led documentary series into British institutions or communities
Presenter-led documentary series with established talent
History docs with strong narrative storytelling and broad appeal
Science and natural history accessible to mainstream audiences
Medical documentaries with dramatic storytelling and emotional impact
format_specifications: Primetime scheduling where applicable; platform premieres for streamers
Both series and one-off formats depending on story and slot
budget_parameters: Documentary: £100K–£250K per hour; Specialist Factual: £120K–£280K per hour
technical_requirements: Broadcast/streaming standards; details provided upon commissioning
Subtitles/captions; audio description per broadcaster requirements
current_calls: Reflect latest broadcaster priorities as outlined above; commissioner-specific interests included.
submission_process: One-page outline with headline, premise and format
additional_info: Increased focus on distinctive voices and cross-platform reach; emphasis on diverse voices on- and off-screen; encouragement of sustainable production practices; support for projects across the UK; open to pitches from independent producers.
